website_summaries.verdict: This MSI card is a near-stock GTX 1050 Ti, but that's not a bad thing. It performs well for 1080p gaming and is affordable, plain and simple.
pros: No PCIe power connector required and 300-watt power-supply requirement
cons: Auto-boosts well, but doesn't overclock much beyond the out-of-box OC

customer_reviews.title: Good for most titles don't expect gaming 4k
customer_reviews.text: Play play play! 49 inch samsung curved 120mhz curved screen, game on
customer_reviews.author: Ionut macinoi

customer_reviews.title: Superdooper
customer_reviews.text: Great chipset, plays gta v on high, Cant beat it for the £
customer_reviews.author: aly

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: good. can run most games but not high quality games like pubg and battlefield v unless its low graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Fasih k.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: Although this card is not exactly a powerhouse in relation to 1080Ti's and 2080's etc it still packs a very big punch for the low price point. I have tested this card in a new rig for a customer and it runs COD perfectly well with the settings pushed past medium settings (which is ample). Overclocking is also very simple with MSI's simple-to-use software. Overall I would recommend this card if your budget doesn't stretch to a 1070 level card.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: fitted to my old pc & had no problems. picture is so much better that before. not high end graphics card but good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING GPU
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING. Great GPU for the price compared to the GTX 1060 or GTX 1070 right now. Absolutely great, can now run pretty much ANY game at 1080p medium/high settings at 60fps+. Games that work really well with this are; Overwatch, DOOM (2016), Fortnite, Minecraft, CS:GO, League Of Legends and ANY Indie game should work. Other than those, as long as the games are somewhat well optimised the GTX 1050 Ti will get it done.
customer_reviews.author: Liam K.

customer_reviews.title: Very good graphics card
customer_reviews.text: I have since replaced this with GTX 1070 and see no difference in performance the 1050 performs great and uses very little power doing it and very little noise not like its big brother the gtx 1070
customer_reviews.author: Col Mustard

customer_reviews.title: Transformed my PC
customer_reviews.text: Really good, in fact wonderful. All the games I want to play work perfectly whereas previously had a slow lag on anything other than basic games. Only just fit in my large pc tower (had to work around a power lead) so check the dimensions carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Moonbird

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a GTX 750. My games run much better. So good I bought a second one for my wife's computer. Highly recommenced for the price I paid. Open the case, removed the old card, plug this one in, switch on and wait. You may have to reboot if you get no response after a few minutes. The drivers are easy to find and download.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: My Dell optiplex 7010 runs just like a £400 gaming pc. Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Before I got this graphics card I cheaped out and bought a nivadia geforce MSI 710 which made no impact on my 12fps low resolution and minimal settings. Since installing this gtx Geforce 1050ti I now run my games at a whopping 60fps maxed out resolution and settings. Low resolution I get over 100+ fps.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good card for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade my gaming graphics (on a budget) but also add CUDA functionality to improve video rendering and transcoding. On the CUDA front I noticed a X4 improvement which I'm happy with. For gaming, I was able to set all graphical settings to High on "World of Tanks Blitz". A good card for the price but won't break any records if you're a hard core gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are a few options in this but happy overall
customer_reviews.text: I out this in my i7 desktop pc and was able to play rocket league at full settings and also record the game in obs to stream live. GPU was at 94% load so it was maxing out.
customer_reviews.author: Zulf Photography

customer_reviews.title: Definitely an upgrade for my pc.
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking about buying a Radeon RX570 but have always bought Nvidia graphics cards, yeah so Nvidia are more expensive but I guess I'm used to them. Can now play more modern games and on better graphics settings.
customer_reviews.author: A Feist fan

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with the graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with the graphics card. Fantastic hardware and performance for the price. I reviewed a lot before settling for this.
customer_reviews.author: TECH9000

customer_reviews.title: Shame about the price however it is a good card
customer_reviews.text: Obviously these cost a bit more than at launch but it runs well. I use mine for timeline performance in davinci resolve and the cuda helps alot.
customer_reviews.author: Riddle Box

customer_reviews.title: Beginners card
customer_reviews.text: Fast, quick delivery. Though I wish I had waited for the GTX 1060 so it had more grunt but very good card for 1080p, 60fps gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Ian W.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money and time!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of money, has done nothing but crash constantly, tried rolling back drivers as far back as 6 months, every time it crashes the computer, need to get a replacement or a refund!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best budget GPU
customer_reviews.text: This GTX 1050ti is a good budget graphics card for any PC. It gives me great performance, with 60fps on medium settings on most games.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver H.

customer_reviews.title: gaming card
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in my desktop computer as an upgrade for gaming. very happy with the card. easy to install and no hitches
customer_reviews.author: tony coxhead

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the Geforce GT 710 that came with my pc brought from Amazon with this. Can run Battlefield 3 on ultra settings consistently above 60 FPS that wasn't possible with the aforementioned graphics card. Installation is a piece of cake, done in around 5 minutes. No regrets, it's been a very good purchase, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Superb product
customer_reviews.text: works brill on my sons PC his games run faster and hes happy
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 1440p gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great card, i am playing most games in 1440p at 30 - 50 fps and thats great for me. (eg. farcry primal, tomb raider, the division) its so much better than i expected.
customer_reviews.author: Arran Yates

customer_reviews.title: Improved gaming
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. He initially had some issues with set up, once installed he couldn't use his screen but as it turned out he had knocked another component out of place and once he fixed this issue it was very easy to install. He was very pleased with how well it works and it has massively improved his gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really special upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Had to purchess a new pc case to place it in but now it is up and running it is a fine upgrade feom what I have and I love it
customer_reviews.author: Michael park

customer_reviews.title: powerful budget GPU
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well for the games i play, everything at max near enough and it doesnt even require a connection to the power supply! AMAZING. Great price and specs. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Ham

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Really good value for money and good performance for budget gaming.
customer_reviews.author: S. MERMIER

customer_reviews.title: Decent budget card!
customer_reviews.text: Great card, was unsure at first and thought it would be too budget but it has more bang than the buck, would recommend to anyone making a budget gaming pc
customer_reviews.author: Vukki

customer_reviews.title: Thick boi
customer_reviews.text: It is quite a girthy boy. Had this in my personal computer for time. Good thick boy..... Quite veiny too-
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with product.. Will recommend to family and friends...
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product.. Will recommend to family and friends...
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: It does not need anything from the power supply it’s just plug it in to the board and away you go
customer_reviews.text: Mint card it’s just slot in and go my old card has to put in x6 six pin power took me 20 mins to realise that this one didn’t need to plug it in when the fans are going at 100 tho it’s can be loud but move it down to 90 no different in performance over all mint card
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out If You Have a VGA Monitor
customer_reviews.text: What NVIDIA don’t tell you is that the GEForce 10 series have no analogue feed, so ‘passive’ cheap VGA converters won’t work, you have to get a more expensive ‘active’ (= converts digital to analogue) DVI-D/HDMI/DP to VGA adapter if you have an older VGA-only monitor....just be warned....
customer_reviews.author: D Boag

customer_reviews.title: Performs well for this pricepoint
customer_reviews.text: Sadly my system is now RAM-limited, but that's not the fault of this graphics card,, great at this price ;)
customer_reviews.author: Milo K

customer_reviews.title: Good for CsGo
customer_reviews.text: I play with an AMD fx 6300 (which sucks btw) and now a GTX 1050ti, settings med-med-low-low-x8 and i'm getting 160fps average. I would recommend getting a i59600 rather than go AMD if you want to game though. DMG btw :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to setup. Great price for beginners to start gaming! Definitely recommend the purchase. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Wattsdaniel746

customer_reviews.title: great graphics card
customer_reviews.text: excelnt for the price would buy again play and stream games with no problems
customer_reviews.author: simon simmons

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fit
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well in my sons computer, allowing him to play games that he couldn't play before it was fitted. Easy to fit. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P.

customer_reviews.title: Grap
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my x box for graphics and the lagging
customer_reviews.author: ian mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Can’t even download the drivers because NVIDIA GeFore experience says “requires an NVIDIA GPU” the graphics card recognised itself as a Radeon 3000, I spent £500 upgrading my pc and still would not work. sending back and buying a different graphics card ELSEWHERE.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: great value, best card for a SFF box
customer_reviews.text: Awesome graphics card as I updated from an old GT610, the GTX1050ti is the most powerful card that will fit in a low profile design, although to give it enough power I had to disconnect the optical drive (no biggy there, just need to upgrade the PSU to something higher to be able to use it)
customer_reviews.author: Trev

customer_reviews.title: You can get a gtx 1060 for 10 pounds more which smashes this card ^^
customer_reviews.text: Wow for 20 pounds more I can get a gtx1060 which decimates this gpu  Amazing
customer_reviews.author: HalfDone

product_meta.title: MSI Geforce GTX 1050 TI 4G OC GeForce GTX1050TI Graphic Card 4096 MB
product_meta.description: Style Name:GTX 1050 TI 4G OC| Size Name:4 GBAs the world's most popular gaming graphics card vendor, MSI is proud to introduce its full line up of graphics cards based on NVIDIA's new Pascal GPU with fierce new looks and Supreme performance to match. Building on the monumental success of MSI award winning GTX 10 gaming Series, the MSI GeForce GTX 1050/1050 Ti Series are kept cool by a scaled down version of the imposing twin Frozr VI thermal design, allowing for higher Core and memory clock speeds for increased performance in games. The recognizable shapes of the eye-catching twin Frozr cooler are intensified by a fiery red gaming glow piercing through the Cover, which can be animated together with the MSI gaming Dragon LED on the side. A completely tailored 4-phase PCB design using military class 4 components with an 6-pin power connector enables higher overclocking performance to push your graphics card to the max.
feature_bullets: Game stream to NVIDIA Shield.Dimensions: 182.0 x 69.0 x 35.0 mm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars157 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
